title: How to Sort on Google Sheets on Android

steps.title: Open the Google Sheets app on your Android.
steps.content: Open the Google Sheets app on your Android. The Sheets app looks like a white spreadsheet table on a green document icon. You can find it on your Apps menu.

steps.title: Tap the file you want to edit.
steps.content: Tap the file you want to edit. Find the spreadsheet you want to edit on your saved files list, and open it.

steps.title: Tap the header letter at the top of a column.
steps.content: Tap the header letter at the top of a column. Every column has a capitalized letter header at the top of your spreadsheet. Tapping it will select and highlight the entire column.

steps.title: Tap the ⋮ icon.
steps.content: Tap the ⋮ icon. This button is in the upper-right corner of your screen. It will open all your "Data" menu in a pop-up window.

steps.title: Tap Create a filter on the menu.
steps.content: Tap Create a filter on the menu. The filter toolbar will slide in from the bottom of your screen.

steps.title: Tap the Sort icon.
steps.content: Tap the Sort icon. This button looks like three horizontal lines in the lower-right corner of your screen. It will open your "Sort and filter" menu.

steps.title: Select a sorting method.
steps.content: Select a sorting method. You can sort your column in alphabetical or reverse-alphabetical order. Selecting a method will re-organize and sort all the data in the selected column. If you select A to Z , the column will be sorted alphabetically. Z to A will sort the column in reverse-alphabetical order.
